case_title: Muhammad Abid Iqbal vs District Election Commissioner, etc.
complaint_summary: Appellants challenged rejection of nomination papers for various seats citing procedural and legal grounds.
investigation_summary: Nomination papers were rejected by Returning Officers citing issues such as proposer not being registered in the ward, withdrawal of nomination papers by co-candidates, and other procedural discrepancies.
judgment_summary: The court dismissed the Intra Court Appeals, citing the availability of an appellate remedy under Sub-rule (10) of Rule 14 of the Punjab Local Government (Conduct of Elections) Rules, 2013, and the proviso to sub-section (2) of section 3 of the Law Reforms Ordinance, 1972.
Decision_or_verdict: Intra Court Appeals dismissed with no order as to cost.
legal_arguments: Proviso to sub-section (2) of section 3 of the Law Reforms Ordinance, 1972 prohibits Intra Court Appeals where appellate remedies are available.
Sub-rule (10) of Rule 14 of the Punjab Local Government (Conduct of Elections) Rules, 2013 provides an appellate remedy against decisions of Returning Officers.
statutes: Punjab Local Government (Conduct of Elections) Rules, 2013
sections: Rule 14(10) of Punjab Local Government (Conduct of Elections) Rules, 2013
citations: Unreported order dated 12.10.2015 in I.C.A. No.1305 of 2015
key_issues: Competency of Intra Court Appeals under proviso to section 3(2) of Law Reforms Ordinance, 1972
Procedural validity of nomination paper rejection

legal_terms.Intra Court Appeal: An appeal filed within the same court to a larger bench.

words_and_phrases.Proviso: A clause in a statute or contract that qualifies or restricts the main provision.

summary_vector_notes: The case involved multiple appellants challenging rejection of nomination papers for local government elections. The court dismissed the appeals, citing the availability of appellate remedies under existing laws, making the Intra Court Appeals incompetent.
